greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array of generalized Ulam numbers U(n,k), n>=1, k>=2, read by antidiagonals: U(n,k) = n if n<=k; for n>k, U(n,k) = least number > U(n-1,k) which is a unique sum of k distinct terms U(i,k) with i<n.
comment: The columns are Ulam-type sequences - see A002858 for further information.  Some of these sequences - but not all - seem to have quite simple generating functions.
maple: elif h=1 then t:= v(n, k);
else t:= b(n -U(i, k), i-1, k, h-1);
else for m from U(n-1, k)+1
while b(m, n-1, k, k)<>1 do od;
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_, h_] := b[n, i, k, h] = Module[{t}, Which[n < 0 || h < 0, 0, n == 0, If[h == 0, 1, 0], i == 0 || h == 0, 0, h == 1, t = v[n, k]; If[t > 0 && t <= i, 1, 0], True, t = b[n-U[i, k], i-1, k, h-1]; t+If[t > 1, 0, b[n, i-1, k, h]] ] ]; v[_, _] = 0; U[n_, k_] := U[n, k] = Module[{m}, If[n <= k, v[n, k] = n, For[m = U[n-1, k]+1, b[m, n-1, k, k] != 1, m++]; v[m, k] = n; m] ]; Table[Table[U[n, 2+d-n], {n, 1, d}], {d, 1, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 23 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_ and _Alois P. Heinz_, Jan 05 2011
